record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="File Display command panel" and format.name="fdisp" and syslanguage="en"
record.recordid: File Display command panel - fdisp - en
record.format.name: fdisp

brief.brief: The File Display command panel displays a list of records using the default search form or a specified form.

detail.detail: File: (file variable) Specify the file variable containing the list of records to display.
Format: (character) Specify the name of the form to use to display the record (defaults to <filename>.qbe).
Prompting Message: (character) Specify the prompting message to display at the top of the screen.
Condition for Option: (array of Booleans) Specify a condition that determines whether to display the corresponding option key.
Description: (array of characters) Describe what the option does.
Exit: (array of labels) Specify the exit to take if a user selects the option.
If you leave the form field blank, Service Manager creates a temporary default form to display the records.
This form only displays keyed fields.
You can use Forms Designer to create new forms.
Lines at the top of the form, which do not contain input fields, are headers and are not repeated for each record in the list.
Under most circumstances, use the Select panel to select a list of records.
The Enter key invokes a normal exit.
The record pointed to by the cursor becomes the current record in the table.
